numlitem.para: Approach minimums do not require its use, and
All takeoffs and landings are made by a pilot with access to an operating tiller.
The Captain will make all takeoffs and landings and the following procedures shall be used.

Takeoff: The Captain will steer the aircraft, manipulating the steering wheel control with his hand, until the rudder becomes effective (approximately 40 to 50 kts). The crewmember not flying should assist by keeping the wings level and a light forward pressure on the control column until the tiller is no longer required for steering.

Landing: The Captain should use the rudder and steering wheel control as required during the landing roll. The other crewmember should assist by keeping the wings level and a forward pressure on the control column.
For Autoland conditions requiring LAND 3 ASA annunciation, rudder pedal nosewheel steering is required.
Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.
Captain performs all takeoffs and landings.

placard.para: Placard near each pilot’s Airspeed Indicator "RUDDER PEDAL NWS INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Verify that rudder pedal interconnect mechanism failure will not jam other system controls:
Visually inspect mechanism below flight compartment floor for broken or disconnected components.
Displace rudder pedals full travel in both directions to ensure that pedals move freely.
Test tiller steering system as follows:
Install downlocks for the nose and main landing gear.
Open the doors for the nose landing gear and install the door lock.
Disconnect nose gear torque links and stow them to avoid any interference when the nose gear tiller is moved full left and right.
Pressurize the left hydraulic system.
Using Captain's tiller, operate steering through full left and right envelope and verify that no system binding occurs.
Depressurize the left hydraulic system.
Reconnect nose gear torque links.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
